# Download

```{r, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
source("../functions.R")
config <- load_config("../../")
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE, comment = NA)

df <- readRDS(file.path(config$wd, "model-predict-derived.rds"))
```

## Stream Temperature Model Predictions Dataset

The stream temperature model predictions can be downloaded as a static CSV file from the following link.

> **[Stream Temperature Predictions v`r config$version` (csv)](https://ecosheds.org/models/stream-temperature/output/sheds-temp-model-v`r config$version`.csv)**

This file contains the following columns:

```{r}
df_vars <- tribble(
  ~column, ~label,
  "mean_max_temp", "Mean Annual Max Temp (degC)",
  "max_max_temp", "Maximum Temp (degC)",
  "mean_jun_temp", "Mean June Temp (degC)",
  "mean_jul_temp", "Mean July Temp (degC)",
  "mean_aug_temp", "Mean August Temp (degC)",
  "mean_summer_temp", "Mean Summer Temp (degC)",
  "max_temp_30d", "Max 30-day Mean Temp (degC)",
  "n_day_temp_gt_18", "Mean # Days per Year Temp > 18 C",
  "n_day_temp_gt_20", "Mean # Days per Year Temp > 20 C",
  "n_day_temp_gt_22", "Mean # Days per Year Temp > 22 C",
  "n_day_temp_gte_24_9", "Mean # Days per Year Temp >= 24.9 C",
  "n_day_temp_gte_27", "Mean # Days per Year Temp >= 27 C",
  "resist", "Resistivity"
) %>% 
  crossing(air_temp = seq(0, 6, by = 2)) %>% 
  mutate(
    column = if_else(air_temp == 0, column, str_c(column, "_air", air_temp)),
    label = if_else(air_temp == 0, label, str_c(label, " w/ Air Temp +", air_temp, " degC"))
  ) %>% 
  select(column, label)

df_columns <- tribble(
  ~column, ~label,
  "featureid", "Catchment ID"
) %>% 
  bind_rows(df_vars)
knitr::kable(df_columns, col.names = c("CSV Column", "Description"), align = "rl")
```

## Catchment Delineation Shapefiles

The [SHEDS catchment delineation](https://conte-ecology.github.io/shedsGisData/) (NHDHRDV2) are available as a series of shapefiles, pre-staged by 2-digit hydrologic unit codes (HUCs). The model predictions and covariates CSV files can be joined to these shapefiles using the mutual `featureid` column.

```{r}
knitr::include_graphics("img/hydrologic-regions.png")
```

- [Region 01 Catchments (zipped shp)](https://ecosheds.org/assets/nhdhrd/v2/spatial_01.zip)
- [Region 02 Catchments (zipped shp)](https://ecosheds.org/assets/nhdhrd/v2/spatial_02.zip)
- [Region 03 Catchments (zipped shp)](https://ecosheds.org/assets/nhdhrd/v2/spatial_03.zip)
- [Region 04 Catchments (zipped shp)](https://ecosheds.org/assets/nhdhrd/v2/spatial_04.zip)
- [Region 05 Catchments (zipped shp)](https://ecosheds.org/assets/nhdhrd/v2/spatial_05.zip)
- [Region 06 Catchments (zipped shp)](https://ecosheds.org/assets/nhdhrd/v2/spatial_06.zip)

The documentation for the catchment delineation is also available:

> **[Catchment Delineation (NHDHRDV2) Documentation (docx)](https://ecosheds.org/assets/nhdhrd/v2/NHDHRDV2_Documentation.docx)**

## Catchment Covariates Dataset

The [SHEDS catchment covariates](https://conte-ecology.github.io/shedsGisData/) are available as a series of CSV files, pre-staged by 2-digit hydrologic unit codes (HUCs). The covariates contain the catchment characteristics that are used as input variables to the stream temperature model.

- [Region 01 Covariates (zipped csv)](https://ecosheds.org/assets/nhdhrd/v2/covariates_01.zip)
- [Region 02 Covariates (zipped csv)](https://ecosheds.org/assets/nhdhrd/v2/covariates_02.zip)
- [Region 03 Covariates (zipped csv)](https://ecosheds.org/assets/nhdhrd/v2/covariates_03.zip)
- [Region 04 Covariates (zipped csv)](https://ecosheds.org/assets/nhdhrd/v2/covariates_04.zip)
- [Region 05 Covariates (zipped csv)](https://ecosheds.org/assets/nhdhrd/v2/covariates_05.zip)
- [Region 06 Covariates (zipped csv)](https://ecosheds.org/assets/nhdhrd/v2/covariates_06.zip)

The documentation for catchment covariates is also available:

> **[Catchment Covariates Documentation (docx)](https://ecosheds.org/assets/nhdhrd/v2/NHDHRDV2_Covariate_Documentation.xlsx)**
